intro: Quararibea martini, commonly known as the yellow-leafed sycamore, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are typically bright yellow or green. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
